title: runtime error: integer divide by zero
body:
# üêû Bug Report ### Description As titled. Beacon-chain crashes with a divide by zero error. ### Has this worked before in a previous version? Never seen this error before. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Beacon-chain is currently syncing connected to a modified geth. ## üî• Error 

Feb 24 18:09:41 bc-prod-eth-prysm beacon-chain[1312]: time="2023-02-24 18:09:41" level=info msg="Processing block batch of size 1 starting from  0x6090b2e3... 5868540/5869846 - estimated time remaining 1h2m11s" blocksPerSecond=0.3 peers=55 prefix=initial-sync
Feb 24 18:09:41 bc-prod-eth-prysm beacon-chain[1312]: time="2023-02-24 18:09:41" level=warning msg="Skip processing batched blocks" error="beacon node doesn't have a parent in db with root: 0x3c1d8e6bedb2c287942dbfe7362c5454c001216e7d86fb12b04caa97d1201e0f (in processBatchedBlocks, slot=5868540)" prefix=initial-sync
Feb 24 18:09:42 bc-prod-eth-prysm beacon-chain[1312]: time="2023-02-24 18:09:42" level=debug msg="Searching for non-skipped slot" headEpoch=183389 prefix=initial-sync start=5868539 targetEpoch=183430
Feb 24 18:09:42 bc-prod-eth-prysm beacon-chain[1312]: time="2023-02-24 18:09:42" level=debug msg="Requesting blocks" capacity=1 count=32 peer=16Uiu2HAmJxiZu1zRoydXvChr5g1oh6Dkx8egY8zWUh9gRxTKFLUR prefix=initial-sync score="[100.0%, raw: 64.00,  blocks: 0/640]" start=5868540 step=1
Feb 24 18:09:42 bc-prod-eth-prysm beacon-chain[1312]: time="2023-02-24 18:09:42" level=debug msg="Slowing down for rate limit" peer=16Uiu2HAmJxiZu1zRoydXvChr5g1oh6Dkx8egY8zWUh9gRxTKFLUR prefix=initial-sync
Feb 24 18:09:42 bc-prod-eth-prysm beacon-chain[1312]: time="2023-02-24 18:09:42" level=debug msg="Context closed, exiting goroutine (blocks fetcher)" prefix=initial-sync
Feb 24 18:09:42 bc-prod-eth-prysm beacon-chain[1312]: panic: runtime error: integer divide by zero
Feb 24 18:09:42 bc-prod-eth-prysm beacon-chain[1312]: goroutine 10761 [running]:
Feb 24 18:09:42 bc-prod-eth-prysm beacon-chain[1312]: github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/v3/beacon-chain/sync/initial-sync.timeToWait(...)

## üåç Your Environment **Operating System:** 
  
Ubuntu 20.04.1 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)** 
  
 beacon-chain --version
beacon-chain version Prysm/v3.2.1/0cf1ca8b3cf0c4124fa3183412975721bd31d183. Built at: 2023-02-13 17:23:43+00:00
Okay after some investigations it looks like this was fixed in https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/pull/11988. Can we have another bugfix release please?

@quentinlesceller we are planning a release early next week. Sorry, for the inconvenience! It should be OK to use the prior version of Prysm until this is resolved. 

Closing this as fixed per #11988
